Dunedin company director jailed for evading $560,000 in PAYE, his second conviction https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/dunedin-company-director-jailed-for-evading-560000-in-paye-his-second-conviction/XUTRWHHKUJH5FESOEZLB66D3NM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/dunedin-company-director-jailed-for-evading-560000-in-paye-his-second-conviction/XUTRWHHKUJH5FESOEZLB66D3NM/ Leslie John McKenzie has been sentenced to two and a half years in jail. Thu, 15 Feb 2024 00:46:07 +0000 Leslie John McKenzie pleaded guilty to 48 charges of aiding and abetting his three companies to deduct tax from workers’ wages, which were never passed on to Inland Revenue. He was sentenced to two and a half years’ jail when he appeared in the Dunedin District Court on February 13. Photo / George Heard

Christchurch Port Hills fire explained: The bigger climate picture behind the fire https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/christchurch-port-hills-fire-explained-the-bigger-climate-picture-behind-the-fire/5WAZCRPF2ZBQNG2Y7FCGUV2I2A/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/christchurch-port-hills-fire-explained-the-bigger-climate-picture-behind-the-fire/5WAZCRPF2ZBQNG2Y7FCGUV2I2A/ Jamie MortonWith most of summer over, NZ is only beginning to get its most dangerous fire conditions. Wed, 14 Feb 2024 23:44:00 +0000 Fire danger conditions in the Port Hills area were assessed at “Very High” to “Extreme” when the fire broke out, with low humidity, temperatures reaching into the high 20s and flames fanned by warm, north-to-northwest winds gusting up to 50km/h. Photo / George Heard
